results.title: A Change of Pace
results.brief_description:
A film about the 1983 Australian Lawn Bowls Championship in Adelaide between Jeff Bradley and Jack Christey. Follows the lives of the players both at home and on the greens in the lead-up to the match.

The film begins and concludes with a promotion of the retirement services offered by the ANZ Bank.

results.title: A Chance to save a life
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the mouth-to-mouth resuscitation technique and points out how lives may be saved by prompt action in common accidents. Please note that some of this information is out of date (1998).

results.title: A Cattleman's day
results.creator_credit: Ted Wilson and S A Film, Television and Laboratories
results.brief_description: A typical day in the life of a Central Australian stockman. Breaking camp in the early morning, saddling up a fresh horse and mustering half-wild cattle into a mob for sorting, counting and branding. The aboriginal stockmen are particularly adept. At the end of the day the cattle are turned loose and wander back to their familiar ground. Music by Isador Goodman.

results.title: A Career in hotels and restaurants
results.brief_description: The hotel and restaurant business as a career: a visit by two young people to a hotel where the manager greets them and shows them all the departments, explaining the background for every job and the prospects for entrants. Encourages school leavers to ask if they too can visit a local hotel and look behind the scenes.

results.title: A Building survives: Olderfleet
results.brief_description: Features an interview with the architects and/or builders who renovated the Olderfleet building in Collins Street, Melbourne without destroying its original facade. From the ABC television program “This Day Tonight” October 1973.

results.title: A Brother for Susan
results.creator_credit: Winifred Holmes, Oswald Skilbeck and Southalls Ltd
results.brief_description: An account of the processes of human gestation from fertilization to the birth of a child. The film answers many question which arise in the mind of a fourteen-year-old child. Shows the visits of the mother to a baby clinic; explains how the human egg is fertilized; how menstruation ceases; the creation of the embryo, its growth to a nine-month baby, and its ultimate delivery.

results.title: A Breath of air
results.brief_description: The film’s main purpose is to help to discourage cigarette smoking by teenagers. It presents to secondary school students a summary of biological and other scientific evidence on the health hazards of smoking. The film contains animated sequences, microphotography, still photos and charts which effectively present its case against smoking cigarettes.

results.title: A Book by it's cover
results.creator_credit: Iowa State University Film Production Unit
results.brief_description: The embellishment of a book is a dying art. This film demonstrates how books are bound with leather binding - showing the handling, tooling and decoration with gold leaf. This decorative, traditional craft is an expensive and slow process and most suitable for collector’s items. No other credits available.

results.title: A Blind child and a sighted child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Selma H. Fraiberg and University of Michigan. Audio-Visual Education Center
results.brief_description: Follows a blind and a sighted child through the sensori-motor period during the first year of life in an attempt to answer the following questions. How is this crucial period affected when one of the major senses is lacking? What are the pathways of progress for the blind infant? What are the limits set by his handicap?
results.title_for_label: A Blind child and a sighted child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Selma H. Fraiberg and University of Michigan. Audio-Visual Education Center

results.title: Music for the movies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young People’s Concert”.
Aaron Copland, famed American composer-pianist, narrates and conducts his own film musical scores. Copland has chosen music from “Red Pony”, “Our Town” and “Something Wild” as a framework in which to show the purpose and meaning of background scores for motion pictures. Featuring the New York Philharmonic.
